author: tersec
content:
This time on `devnet-3` and Erigon, not proposing/attesting because:
```
devops@nimbus-erigon-2 ‚ûú  ~ docker logs snooper-engine 2>&1 | grep SYNCING | wc -l && docker logs snooper-engine 2>&1 | grep VALID | wc -l  
95
0
```
and, yes, Nimbus has been synced (`synced/opt` means CL-synced but not EL-synced, and "almost synced" just happens when there's a missed slot in general):
```
INF 2025-09-16 07:14:11.995+00:00 Slot start                                 topics="beacnde" slot=393821 epoch=12306 sync=synced/opt peers=68 head=ae4da237:393820 finalized=12304:c605dba8 delay=817us339ns
INF 2025-09-16 07:14:23.996+00:00 Slot start                                 topics="beacnde" slot=393822 epoch=12306 sync=synced/opt peers=68 head=46730551:393821 finalized=12304:c605dba8 delay=478us36ns
INF 2025-09-16 07:14:35.997+00:00 Slot start                                 topics="beacnde" slot=393823 epoch=12306 sync="almost synced/opt" peers=68 head=46730551:393821 finalized=12304:c605dba8 delay=678us709ns
INF 2025-09-16 07:14:47.998+00:00 Slot start                                 topics="beacnde" slot=393824 epoch=12307 sync=synced/opt peers=68 head=0f3b0d27:393823 finalized=12304:c605dba8 delay=544us655ns
INF 2025-09-16 07:14:59.995+00:00 Slot start                                 topics="beacnde" slot=393825 epoch=12307 sync=synced/opt peers=68 head=6ec86fbf:393824 finalized=12305:dadfd44c delay=873us924ns
```
and it's not clear if/how it's making sync progress.

author: barnabasbusa
content: <@&1367819082019377202> those of you that have backfill working, do you keep updating the earliest available slot all the way to slot 0, or do you keep it updated with 18d rolling window? I saw that lh potentially updates it all the way back to slot 0, which means that they either advertise incorrectly the earliest available slot, or keep historical blobs all the way back to genesis (which is probably not the case).

author: barnabasbusa
content: prysm also seems to be reporting an older than 18d slot for their earliest available slot (24d) - so the same question goes to them I guess

author: barnabasbusa
content: Whats the reason not to keep updating it once an epoch with a rolling window of 18d worth of epochs?

author: manunlp
content:
> those of you that have backfill working, do you keep updating the earliest available slot all the way to slot 0
If backfill goes back up the the first slot of the weak subjectivity period, at the end of backfill, the `earliest_available_slot` should be `max(0, current_slot - week_subjectivity_period*slotsPerEpoch)`.

author: pk910
content: yes, this is intentional. Barnabas & Sam are working on the blob schedule proposal and it seems numbers start looking bad with more blobs

author: parithosh
content: Yeah we wanna get higher confidence on blob counts around ~20, rather than cranking blob counts and not having high confidence in any numbers at all

author: pawandhananjay
content:
the `earliest_available_slot` is the earliest available block slot we got. 
We prune only blobs older than the 18d retention period, we keep blocks. 
So when we advertise a `earliest_available_slot` of 0, we are saying, we have all blocks since genesis and will be able to give you all blobs upto the current retention period

author: manunlp
content:
Can someone explain what "expose" means in [the spec](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/specs/fulu/das-core.md#reconstruction-and-cross-seeding)?

> If instead the node is not subscribed to the corresponding subnet, it SHOULD still expose the availability of the DataColumnSidecar as part of the gossip emission process.

author: jtraglia
content:
I'm not actually sure. Let's ask <@857052906495017000>; I believe he wrote it:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/commit/6711acf3e295775273397f9d7968e33c9000bd45
